Widths

The 'width' classes refer to the widths that can be set on html elements that refers to their width relative to their container element.

These classes are not related to the element width classes that are set in the grid system but are deisgned to be used seperately.

Example uses are for images in paragraph content, call outs, or for advertising space etc.

Widths at Breakpoints

The widths classes can also be used at various breakpoints, so that the elements can have styles applied to them as necessary at the various breakpoints.

Various Breakpoints

Full width at smallest, half width at small, third width at medium, quarter width at large.
